description: Single storey extension and canopy structure to west wing of existing school building; two (2) single storey extensions to east wing of existing school building; single storey infill extension to north wing of existing school building; associated external and internal works; and landscaping (Use Class F1) (Regulation 3 Application by London Borough of Ealing)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings and supporting documents:
PL001 (Location Plan - Phase 3B);
PL002 Rev A (Existing Site Plan-Demolition and Tree Protection Plan-Ph3B);
PL003 Rev A (Existing Site - Underground Drainage and Service
Coordination-Ph3B);
PL101 Rev A (Proposed Site - Logistics and Access-Ph3B);
PL102 Rev A (Proposed Site Plan-Ph3B);
PL103 Rev A (Proposed Site - Underground Drainage and Service Coordination-Ph3B);
PL104 Rev A (Proposed Site Plan-Ph3B);
PL105 Rev A (Proposed Site - Fencing and Security Plan-Ph3B);
PL106 Rev A (Proposed Site - Roof Plan-Ph3B);
PL107 Rev A (Proposed Site - Fire Strategy Plan);
PL108 Rev A (Proposed Site - Part M);
PL109 Rev A (Proposed Site - Urban Green Factor Masterplan-Ph3B);
PL201 Rev A (Existing and Proposed Site Elevation 1 - Sht 1 of 5);
PL202 Rev A (Existing and Proposed Site Elevation 2 - Sht 2 of 5);
PL203 Rev A (Existing and Proposed Site Elevation 3 - Sht 3 of 5);
PL204 Rev A (Existing and Proposed Site Elevation 4 - Sht 4 of 5);
PL205 (Existing and Proposed Site Elevation 5 & 6 - Sht 1of 5);
PL401 (Proposed Site 3D View 1 of 3 - Phase 3B);
PL402 (Proposed Site 3D View 2 of 3 - Phase 3B);
PL403 (Proposed Site 3D View 3 of 3 - Phase 3B);
P001 (Existing Ground Floor - Occupancy-Phase 3B);
P002 (Existing Ground Floor - Demolition-Phase 3B);
P003 (Existing Roof Plan - Demolition-Phase 3B);
P102 Rev A (Proposed Ground Floor Plan-Phase 3B);
P201 Rev A (Existing and Proposed Building Elevations 1 of 5-Phase 3B);
P202 (Existing and Proposed Building Elevations 2 of 5-Phase 3B);
P203 Rev A (Existing and Proposed Building Elevations 3 of 5-Phase 3B);
P204 (Existing and Proposed Building Elevations 4 of 5-Phase 3B);
P205 (Existing and Proposed Building Elevations 5 of 5-Phase 3B);
P401 Rev A (Existing and Proposed Building-3D View - 1 of 4-Phase 3B);
P402 (Existing and Proposed Building-3D View - 2 of 4-Phase 3B);
P403 (Existing and Proposed Building-3D View - 3 of 4-Phase 3B);
P404 (Existing and Proposed Building-3D View - 4 of 4-Phase 3B);
Design and Access Statement, dated 06/10/2023;
Ground Investigation, July 2023 (ref. 177146 Rev 0);
Tree Survey Schedule, July 2023;
Asbestos Survey Report (ref. 177146);
Environmental Noise Assessment (ref. 1077-MAL-XX-XX-RP-Y-9000);
Preliminary Ecological Appraisal, dated 21/08/2022 (ref. GNP23)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| Notwithstanding the approved drawings and supporting documents, details of materials and finishes to be used for the external building surfaces shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, prior to commencement of the development. The development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details and retained as such thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surroundings in accordance with Policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft Local Plan (Regulation 18).

| Notwithstanding the approved drawings and supporting documents, details of hard and soft landscaping, tree planting, pond, boundary treatment and furniture shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, prior to commencement of the development. The development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details and retained as such thereafter.

Reason: To ensure appropriate hard and soft landscaping and tree planting in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, to ensure appropriately landscaped amenity space, in accordance with Policies D3, D4 and D8 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft Local Plan (Regulation 18).

| Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, a school travel plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved school travel plan.

Reason: To promote the use of sustainable modes of transport and minimise traffic and parking congestion on neighbouring streets and to minimise the impact on residential amenity in accordance with Policies T1, T2, T4, T5 and T6 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 1.1 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy, Policy 7A of Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Ealing's SPD 'Sustainable Transport for New Development'.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the recommendations set in the Preliminary Ecological Appraisal (ref. GNP23) dated 21/08/2022 unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: To mitigate the potential harm to ecology and improve biodiversity in accordance with G6 of the London Plan (2021).

| Prior to use, details shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing, of plant/ machinery/ equipment/ducting/air in- and outlets/ mechanical installations and their external rating noise level (LAr,Tr), together with mitigation measures as appropriate. The measures shall ensure that the emitted external rating noise level will be lower than the lowest existing background sound level LA90 by 10dBA at the most noise sensitive receiver locations at the development site and at surrounding premises. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014 +A1 2019, with all plant/equipment operating together at maximum capacity. Where required, a post installation sound assessment shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing. The assessment shall be carried out to confirm compliance with the noise criteria and shall include additional steps to mitigate noise as necessary. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation/ use of plant/ machinery/ equipment and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft Local Plan (Regulation 18).

| Prior to use, machinery, plant or equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft Local Plan (Regulation 18).

| Prior to use, gate posts shall be installed with proprietary anti-vibration isolators to prevent structural or airborne vibration noise being transmitted to noise sensitive premises and the closing mechanism shall be buffered to adequately silence the operation of the gates.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of surrounding occupiers is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft Local Plan (Regulation 18).

| The use of new halls and classrooms shall not commence until all external doors have been fitted with self-closing devices, which shall be maintained in an operational condition and at no time shall any external door nor windows be fixed in an open position during the emission of noise, smell, smoke or fumes.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise /odour /smoke /fumes, in accordance with Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft Local Plan (Regulation 18).

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of a noise impact assessment and mitigation provided by a sound barrier along the hardstanding area to the south east of the site, in accordance with criteria and specifications outlined in the Council's SPG10. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation /use of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft Local Plan (Regulation 18).

| Prior to the installation of rebound fencing, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of materials, method of construction, fittings and maintenance including resilient linings and bracket mounts to reduce resonance and ball impact noise and resulting noise levels at noise sensitive premises. The fencing shall be installed in accordance with the approved details and shall be permanently retained as such thereafter.

Reason: To safeguard residential amenity, in accordance with Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft Local Plan (Regulation 18).
| During the implementation of the development hereby approved, control measures shall ensure that the following standards and requirements are implemented and adhered to:
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (no work on public holidays),

- notifications of works to interested parties and regular neighbour liaison,  - public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works in case of emergencies or complaints.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), Policy DAA of Ealing's draft Local Plan (Regulation 18), the Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006) and BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise density.

application_details.scheme_name: Wood End Primary School Accommodation Consolidation
